Contributor: B.N., artist.; American Field Service, publisher.;
Note: Initials "B.N." appear on the illustration. Date based on America's participation in the war. Orientation: Vertical.
Description: Text says to read the story of the finest thing America has done in the war told by the boys who daily face death. It is the proud record of the field service of the American Ambulance. Illustration is a sketch of flags draped together in a banner  over the words "Friends of France."
Digital Collection: Allied Posters of World War I
Publisher: Place of publication not identified : American Ambulance Field Service,
Local Rights Statement: This material is made available for private study, scholarship, and research use. For access to the original or a high resolution reproduction, contact: Temple University Libraries, Special Collections Research Center, scrc@temple.edu, 215-204-8257.
